Message.Title: Alibaba repeats the similar story as the Focus Media Holding from China..
Message.Msg: open Wikipedia, search for Focus Media Holding. They have claimed explosive in ads revenues before IPO, but after the IPO, their e/r were scrutinized and finally In November 2011, Muddy Waters Research reported massive fraud at the company. It alleged that the company has been fraudulently overstating the number of screens in its LCD network by approximately 50%, has claimed to acquire, write down, and dispose of companies that it never actually purchased, has written at least 21 acquisitions down to zero and then given them away for no consideration, has been used by insiders as their counterparty in trading in and out of subsidiary Allyes, with several individuals earning a total of at least $70.1 million, while shareholders lost $159.6 million.[1] Focus denied the allegations. I have seen this movie before and it appears the same plot with different actors....

Message.Title: Ralph Schackart, William Blair The company initiated disappointing third‐quarter guidance, missing consensus expectations on both the top and bottom lines with the potential for a third consecutive quarter of declining revenue growth
Message.Msg: Ralph Schackart, William Blair: Reiterates a Market Perform rating. “At $29.55 premarket, Yahoo shares trade at an EV/EBITDA multiple of 20.0 times and a P/E multiple of 21.6 times using our 2013 estimates (includes Asia assets). The company initiated disappointing third‐quarter guidance, missing consensus expectations on both the top and bottom lines with the potential for a third consecutive quarter of declining revenue growth. We are also concerned about the second consecutive quarter of year‐over‐year pricing declines in display advertising. Yahoo attributed some of the decline to the industry shift toward programmatic buying. Specifically during the quarter, the company cited a lower premium sell‐through rate and pricing on exchanges. These issues give us pause as our checks indicate that dollars are continuing to flow away from premium and into programmatic display buying. We maintain our Market Perform rating given Yahoo’s business fundamentals, while recognizing that Alibaba is driving accelerating operating results.”

Message.Title: John Blackledge, Cowen & Co.: Reiterates a Market Perform rating and a $26 price target.YHOO’s display revenue (x-TAC) of $423MM, down 11% y/y
Message.Msg: John Blackledge, Cowen & Co.: Reiterates a Market Perform rating and a $26 price target. “YHOO’s display revenue (x-TAC) of $423MM, down 11% y/y, was softer than expected driven by a 12% y/y pricing decline given lower premium ads sold and mix shift to more ad unit sold int’ly vs. US, which is lower priced and a 2% y/y decline in ads

Message.Title: BGC Partners Downgrades Yahoo! (YHOO) to Hold, Notes Revenue Growth Issues with price target $21
Message.Msg: BGC Partners downgraded Yahoo! (NASDAQ: YHOO) from Buy to Hold with a price target of $21.00. Analyst Colin Gillis noted growth issues with the company's core business revenue and said realignment of the sales team under COO Henrique De Castro will likely negatively impact display revenue near-term, although it may bear fruit longer-term.

Message.Title: Pivotal Research downgraded Yahoo! (NASDAQ: YHOO) from Buy to Hold with a price target of $26.00 (from $23.00).
Message.Msg: Pivotal Research downgraded Yahoo! (NASDAQ: YHOO) from Buy to Hold with a price target of $26.00 (from $23.00). Analyst Brian Wieser said, "We are incorporating refined valuation estimates of Alibaba Group and Yahoo Japan, and raising our target price to $26 per share. However, given the stock's recent run-up and what we consider to be a "fuller" value (incorporating more refined assumptions around Alibaba) we downgrade Yahoo."

Message.Title: Next Stock to Double this Summer
Message.Msg: A major wave of M&A activity is beginning in the cable TV industry. Programming costs are soaring through the roof and cable TV operators need to consolidate and gain leverage to push costs down. As cable TV operators merge and achieve big cost savings, they will rapidly increase their spending on technologies that will fuel the industry's future growth. Cable TV operator stocks are rallying, but the biggest gainers during this summer's consolidation wave will be the industry's leading technology vendors. We could soon see the largest tech vendors like Cisco (CSCO) rapidly acquire smaller cable TV tech pure plays like Seachange (SEAC) and Concurrent (CCUR). An analyst at Brean Capital issued a research note about SEAC in December, which speculated that it's a takeover target, "Because of SEAC's leading position in key areas of MSO investment, it is not likely to remain an independent company in an industry consolidation scenario." The consolidation scenario they alluded to is now getting underway, much sooner than expected. SEAC reached new 52-week highs the past three trading days! Yesterday, SEAC hit a new 52-week high of $12.72 and closed at $12.58. It has a market cap of $412mm with $114.23mm in cash and an enterprise value of $297.77mm or 1.91X revenues of $156.11mm. SEAC is rising due to takeover speculation and CCUR will likely be next to explode! Search for and read the article 'Motorola, Cisco Buyouts Vex VOD Market' to see how CCUR is also a takeover target with Arris reported to have shown interest. CCUR just surpassed SEAC to become the #1 VOD tech vendor, while Arris is #4 and could easily acquire CCUR to dominate the market - both companies based are in Atlanta! CCUR needs to rise to $16.35 just to match SEAC's enterprise value/revenue ratio of 1.91! When CCUR files their 10-K next month, their trailing non-GAAP EPS will likely reach $0.50 and surpass SEAC's non-GAAP EPS of $0.44!

Message.Title: Yahoo Acquires Beijing-based Big Data Analysis Firm
Message.Msg: Beijing-based big data analysis firm Ztelic (Zhituo) announced today on the company's official site that it has been acquired by US internet company Yahoo for an undisclosed sum. Ztelic provides big data analysis services for China's major SNS platforms, including social recruitment, social management, and other vertically applied social data services. Zheng Hao, founder of Ztelic, is a former architect at Yahoo's US research center, and has previously served as CTO of Yahoo's Beijing research center and CTO of Zynga's Asia operations. Upon completion of the acquisition, Zheng will return to Yahoo's Beijing research center at a VP-level position in charge of applied science and customized platform development.

Topic.Title: to the YHOO short

Message.Msg: Yahoo had 5 CEO's in the past few years, the last CEO could not manage a toll both on a major highway. Digital media revenue is down while other companies all show a big gain. When Yahoo gets only $6 billion for the rest of their investment in China the stock will go back to $12 a share. Even the change in the message boards were a step in the wrong direction, maybe the next CEO will put them back the way they were before. The only reason this stock is at $28 is because of their partner at CNBC, the pump champs like Cramer. If Yahoo did not have this message board, their revenue would be cut in half or more. When you post an ad on Google or Microsoft, you get new customers, I did not get anything from Yahoo ads many years ago when I tried them, I hope someone is making money from ads today on Yahoo.

Message.Title: Major Industry Consolidation to Make CCUR Hottest Play on Wall Street!
Message.Msg: A major wave of M&A activity is beginning in the cable TV industry. Programming costs are soaring through the roof and cable TV operators need to consolidate and gain leverage to push costs down. As cable TV operators merge and achieve big cost savings, they will rapidly increase their spending on technologies that will fuel the industry's future growth. Cable TV operator stocks are rallying, but the biggest gainers during this summer's consolidation wave will be the industry's leading technology vendors. We could soon see the largest tech vendors like Cisco (CSCO) rapidly acquire smaller cable TV tech pure plays like Seachange (SEAC) and Concurrent (CCUR). An analyst at Brean Capital issued a research note about SEAC in December, which speculated that it's a takeover target, "Because of SEAC's leading position in key areas of MSO investment, it is not likely to remain an independent company in an industry consolidation scenario." The consolidation scenario they alluded to is now getting underway, much sooner than expected. SEAC reached new 52-week highs the past three trading days! Yesterday, SEAC hit a new 52-week high of $12.72 and closed at $12.58. It has a market cap of $412mm with $114.23mm in cash and an enterprise value of $297.77mm or 1.91X revenues of $156.11mm. SEAC is rising due to takeover speculation and CCUR will likely be next to explode! Search for and read the article 'Motorola, Cisco Buyouts Vex VOD Market' to see how CCUR is also a takeover target with Arris reported to have shown interest. CCUR just surpassed SEAC to become the #1 VOD tech vendor, while Arris is #4 and could easily acquire CCUR to dominate the market - both companies are based in Atlanta! CCUR needs to rise to $16.35 just to match SEAC's enterprise value/revenue ratio of 1.91! When CCUR files their 10-K next month, their trailing non-GAAP EPS will likely reach $0.50 and surpass SEAC's non-GAAP EPS of $0.44!

Message.Title: Yahoo Acquisition #19 for Mayer: Beijing’s Ztelic
Message.Msg: Yahoo has acquired a small Beijing-based company, Ztelic, that analyzes social-network data. A Yahoo spokeswoman said on Thursday that Ztelic was a small “talent acquisition” that would bring eight employees to Yahoo’s research and development team in Beijing. It is the 19th acquisition for Yahoo under CEO Marissa Mayer, who joined a year ago. All but a few of those deals were so-called talent acquisitions. Yahoo’s purchase of Tumblr, Xobni and Summly are the notable exceptions. Ztelic founder Hao Zheng, who is also a former Yahoo employee in China, “will play a critical leadership role in our Beijing Global R&D Center,” splitting his time between that location and Yahoo’s Sunnyvale headquarters, the Yahoo spokeswoman said.
